synopsis: In this heartfelt episode, Devam and Ahir dive into the complexities of anxiety, sharing their personal experiences and insights. They discuss the importance of embracing emotions, the journey of self-acceptance, and the transformative power of vulnerability, all while fostering a supportive dialogue for listeners navigating their own mental health challenges.
quotes: You don't have to worry about this; there's nothing wrong.
Anxiety is like a fog, and that part of you that knows whatâ€™s actually going on is underneath that fog.
Every time you do it, it gets a little easier.
You're not just born with that; you have to develop that over time.
Sometimes it's really bad, and I can remind myself that this feeling is just temporary.
I feel like my anxiety changes from time to time, like guerrilla warfare.
It's not just that it's less frequent; my anxiety is less intense than it was before.
We all need to embrace our sadness and be okay with it.
The hardest part is realizing that even if it gets better, I can still struggle.
